intro: Ferulago trojana, commonly known as the Trojan ferulago, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, somewhat fern-like appearance. Ferulago trojana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
